meanings.definition: Rolfers (noun): practitioners of Rolfing, a form of bodywork aimed at improving posture and movement.
meanings.sent1: The rolfers helped me stand straighter and move more easily.
meanings.sent2: Many rolfers have extensive training in anatomy and physiology.
meanings.sent3: The rolfers joked that they could 'straighten out' anyone who walked through their door.
meanings.sent4: The rolfers were like sculptors, molding bodies into better alignment.
meanings.sent5: After visiting the rolfers, I felt like a new person with improved posture.

meanings.definition: Rolfers (verb): the act of performing Rolfing on a client.
meanings.sent1: She rolfers her clients with care and precision.
meanings.sent2: They rolfers regularly to help people move more freely.
meanings.sent3: He rolfers his friends as a hobby, helping them relax and feel better.
meanings.sent4: Rolfers can be transformative, improving how the body feels and functions.
meanings.sent5: After she rolfers me, I feel like I can move with less effort.
